div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc. In the case of irrational durations, such as such as 2 quarter notes in the time of 5 8th notes in a measure of 5/8 time, decimal values may be used. In this case, the dur.ges attribute would take the value "2.5" if the midi.div attribute's value was "1".

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.ges
div.p: records performed duration information that differs from the written values. Its value may be expressed in one of several forms, such as measures[s]+ beat[s].beatpart, ppq (MIDI clicks), Humdrum **recip values, or MusicXML 'divisions', etc.

div.head: dur.vis
div.p: records the durational symbol used in the source.

div.head: dur.vis
div.p: used to record a non-standard durational symbol used in the source.

div.head: dur.vis
div.p: used to record the visual duration of the tempo marking in the source.

div.head: e
div.p: indicates the setting for the E strings.

div.head: enclose
div.p: records the characters often used to mark the accidental as having an cautionary or editorial function. For an example of cautionary accidentals enclosed in parentheses, see Read, p. 131, ex. 9-14.

div.head: enclose
div.p: encodes the characters used to enclose the accidental when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

div.head: enclose
div.p: encodes the characters used to enclose the accidental when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

div.head: enclose
div.p: encodes the characters used to enclose the rehearsal mark.

div.head: enclose.note
div.p: encodes the characters used to enclose the note when it has a cautionary or editorial function.

div.head: endid
div.p: indicates the final element in the sequence.

div.head: evidence
div.p: indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation. Suggested values include: 'internal', 'external', 'conjecture'.

div.head: expan
div.p: contains an ordered list of IDs of descendant <section>, <ending> or <rdg> elements. This 'expansion list' indicates how the section should be expanded into its 'through-composed' form. For example, expan="A End1 A End2" indicates that the section labelled 'A' comes first, then the ending labelled 'End1', followed by the 'A' section again, and finally the ending labelled 'End2'.

div.head: expan
div.p: records the expansion of the abbreviation.

div.head: expand
div.p: indicates whether to render the source measure instead of the repeat symbol.

div.head: expand
div.p: indicates whether to render the source measures instead of the repeat symbol.

div.head: expand
div.p: indicates whether or not to render the source measures instead of the repeat marking.

div.head: expand
div.p: indicates whether to render the repeated beat symbol or the source material.

div.head: expand
div.p: indicates whether to render the source material.

div.head: extender
div.p: indicates the presence of an extension symbol, typically a dash or underscore, drawn from the end of the harmonic indication to the point indicated by the dur attribute.

div.head: extent
div.p: indicates the extent of the damage.

div.head: extent
div.p: contains an indication of the extent of the omission.

div.head: f
div.p: indicates the setting for the F strings.

div.head: facs
div.p: permits the current element to reference a facsimile image or image zone which corresponds to it.

div.head: fermata
div.p: indicates the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

div.head: fermata
div.p: used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

div.head: fermata
div.p: used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

div.head: fermata
div.p: used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

div.head: fermata
div.p: used to indicate the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a fermata <element> should be employed.

div.head: fermata
div.p: indicates the attachment of a fermata to this element. If visual information about the fermata needs to be recorded, then a <fermata> element should be employed.

div.head: fing
div.p: indicates which finger, if any, should be used to play an individual string. The values 'x' and 'o' indicated stopped and open strings, respectively.

div.head: fontfam
div.p: contains the name of a font-family.

div.head: fontname
div.p: records the name of the font.

div.head: fontsize
div.p: indicates the size of the font in printers' points, i.e., 1/72ths of an inch.

div.head: fontstyle
div.p: records the style of the font, i.e, italic, oblique, or normal.

div.head: fontweight
div.p: used to indicate bold type.

div.head: form
div.p: records the function of the dot; that is, whether it is a dot of augmentation or a dot of division.

div.head: form
div.p: used to identify and format the list. In a "simple" list, <item>s are not numbered or bulleted. In a "marked" list, the sequence of the list items is not critical, and a bullet, box, dash, or other character is displayed at the start of each <item>. In an "ordered" list, the sequence of the items is important, and each <item> is lettered or numbered. Style sheet functions should be used to specify the mark or numeration system for each <item>.

div.head: form
div.p: specifies whether the accidental allows written enharmonic values (explicit) or only performed (implicit) values.

div.head: form
div.p: indicates whether the base symbol is written vertically or horizontally.

div.head: form
div.p: indicates whether this is note-on or note-off velocity data.

div.head: form
div.p: describes the visual appearance of the fermata.

div.head: form
div.p: captures the function of the hairpin.

div.head: form
div.p: describes the bowed tremolo as measured or unmeasured.

div.head: form
div.p: describes whether the tremolo is measured or unmeasured.

div.head: form
div.p: provides an indication of the function of the ligature.

div.head: form
div.p: 'norm' signals the normal form, that is, the written note, followed by its lower neighbor, with a return to the written note, while 'inv' indicates the inverted form, that is, the principal note, followed by its upper neighbor, with a return to the principal note. Traditionally, the 'normal' mordent is written as a short wavy line with a vertical line through it and the inverted mordent is written without the vertical line. However, the meaning of these signs is sometimes reversed. See Read, p. 245-246. Another attribute in the visual domain would be necessary in order to be completely explicit about which visual symbol is actually to be rendered.

div.head: form
div.p: indicates whether the turn begins on the note above (norm) or on the note below (inv).

div.head: form
div.p: provides a subclass or functional label for the neume.

div.head: form
div.p: records the function of the neume.

div.head: fret
div.p: indicates at which the fret a finger should be placed.

div.head: fret
div.p: indicates the fret at which the barre should be created.

div.head: from
div.p: captures the starting note of the barre.

div.head: from
div.p: contains the starting point of a date range.

div.head: func
div.p: If an accidental has an editorial or cautionary function, its function may be captured in the func attribute.

div.head: func
div.p: states whether the line break follows a single line or a line group.

div.head: func
div.p: states the side of a leaf (as in a manuscript) on which the content following the <pb> element occurs.

div.head: g
div.p: indicates the setting for the G strings.

div.head: gliss
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a glissando.

div.head: grace
div.p: Setting the grace attribute here provides the possibility of changing all the grace attribute values in a layer without having to individually change each event's grace attribute value. Each "graced" element may still require a value in its grace.time attribute.

div.head: grace
div.p: Setting the grace attribute here provides the possibility of changing all the grace attribute values in a staff without having to individually change each event's grace attribute value. Each "graced" element may still require a value in its grace.time attribute.

div.head: grace
div.p: Setting the grace attribute here provides the possibility of changing all the grace attribute values in a score without having to individually change each event's grace attribute value. Each "graced" element may still require a value in its grace.time attribute.

div.head: grace
div.p: marks this chord as a grace and records from which note/chord it should "steal" time.

div.head: grace
div.p: marks this chord as a grace and records from which note/chord it should "steal" time.

div.head: grace.time
div.p: records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

div.head: grace.time
div.p: records the amount of time to be "stolen" from a non-grace note/chord.

div.head: halign
div.p: indicates the horizontal alignment of the syllable with respect to the note to which it is attached.

div.head: halign
div.p: specifies the horizontal alignment of the element content.

div.head: hand
div.p: signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in a witness. The value of hand should correspond to the ID of a <hand> element given elsewhere in the document.

div.head: hand
div.p: signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention. Its value must be the ID of a <hand> element declared in the header.

div.head: hand
div.p: signifies the hand responsible for the damage in the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand.

div.head: hand
div.p: Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.

div.head: hand
div.p: signifies the hand which made the deletion in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand.

div.head: headshape
div.p: used to override the headshape normally used for the given duration.

div.head: headshape
div.p: indicates an alternative notehead should be displayed instead of individual noteheads. See Read, p. 320-321, re: tone clusters.

div.head: height
div.p: measurement of the vertical dimension of the image.

div.head: hfunc
div.p: contains an indication of the harmonic function of this neume.

div.head: hfunc
div.p: describes the chord's harmonic function in any convenient typology.

div.head: ho
div.p: records a horizontal adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determinded location in terms of interline distance; that is, units of 1/2 the distance between adjacent staves.

div.head: initial
div.p: marks this hand as the initial one of the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: instr
div.p: provides a way of pointing to a MIDI instrument definition. It must contain the ID of an <instrdef> element elsewhere in the document.

div.head: interval
div.p: specifies the (positive) numeric portion of a time interval.

div.head: inth
div.p: encodes the harmonic interval from a pitch occuring at the same time.

div.head: inth
div.p: encodes the harmonic interval from a pitch occuring at the same time.

div.head: intm
div.p: encodes the melodic interval from the previous neume.

div.head: join
div.p: used for linking visually separate phrase marks, sometimes necessary due to system breaks, that form a single musical phrase. Record the IDs of the separately encoded phrase marks, excluding this one.

div.head: join
div.p: used for linking visually separate slurs, sometimes necessary due to system breaks, that form a single musical phrase. Record the IDs of the separately encoded slurs, excluding this one.

div.head: join
div.p: indicates a measure which metrically completes the current one.

div.head: key
div.p: used to record a value which serves as a primary key in an external database.

div.head: key.mode
div.p: indicates major or minor tonality.

div.head: key.mode
div.p: indicates major, minor, or other tonality.

div.head: key.sig
div.p: indicates where the key is in the circle of fifths.

div.head: key.sig
div.p: indicates where the key lies in the circle of fifths.

div.head: layer
div.p: signifies the layer to which an annotation applies.

div.head: layer
div.p: signifies the layer to which the MIDI event applies.

div.head: layer
div.p: describes the layer to which the <midi> element's children apply.

div.head: layer
div.p: signifies the layer within which the event is active.

div.head: layer
div.p: signifies the layer within which the control event is active.

div.head: layer
div.p: signifies the layer to which the lyrics apply.

div.head: left
div.p: indicates the visual rendition of the left barline. It is present here only for facilitation of translation from legacy encodings which use it. Usually, it can be safely ignored.

div.head: level
div.p: indicates whether this is the title of an article, monograph, journal, series, or unpublished material.

div.head: lig
div.p: indicates this element's participation in a ligature.

div.head: line
div.p: the staff location of the clef. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

div.head: line
div.p: records the position of the clef. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

div.head: line
div.p: indicates the line upon which the rest stands. The value must be in the range between 1 and the number of lines on the staff.

div.head: lines
div.p: indicates the number of stafflines.

div.head: loc
div.p: encodes the staff location of the dot.

div.head: loc
div.p: holds the staff location of the mensuration sign.

div.head: long
div.p: When the long attribute is set to 'yes', a double or long mordent, consisting of 5 notes, is indicated.

div.head: lrx
div.p: indicates the lower-right corner x coordinate.

div.head: lry
div.p: indicates the lower-left corner x coordinate.

div.head: lv
div.p: indicates the attachment of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) sign to this element.

div.head: lv
div.p: indicates the attachment of an l.v. (laissez vibrer) sign to this element.

div.head: medium
div.p: describes the writing medium, such as pencil or ink.

div.head: medium
div.p: describes the writing medium.

div.head: mensur
div.p: the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

div.head: method
div.p: indicates the method employed to mark corrections.

div.head: mfunc
div.p: contains an indication of the melodic function of this element.

div.head: mfunc
div.p: describes the chord's melodic function in any convenient typology.

div.head: midi
div.p: contains a MIDI value, that is, the number of quarter notes per minute in the range from 10 to 1000.

div.head: midi.div
div.p: sets the number of MIDI ticks per quarter note.

div.head: midi.div
div.p: sets the default number of MIDI ticks per quarter note for all staves in the group.

div.head: midi.div
div.p: sets the number of MIDI ticks per quarter note.

div.head: mode
div.p: indicates major, minor, or other tonality.

div.head: modusmaior
div.p: describes the maxima-long relationship.

div.head: modusminor
div.p: describes the long-breve relationship.

div.head: n
div.p: provides a label (name or number) for an element. While its value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token.

div.head: name
div.p: records a name associated with the neume symbol.

div.head: name
div.p: records the name of the neume.

div.head: new
div.p: identifies the new hand. The value must contain the ID of a hand element given elsewhere in the document.

div.head: next
div.p: used to point to the next event(s) in a user-defined collection.

div.head: notafter
div.p: contains an upper boundary for an uncertain date.

div.head: notbefore
div.p: contains a lower boundary for an uncertain date.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num
div.p: Together, num and numbase specify the change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Num is for the first value in the ratio.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num
div.p: holds the number of the MIDI controller.

div.head: num
div.p: records the MIDI channel value.

div.head: num
div.p: records the pressure/after touch value.

div.head: num
div.p: records the note number.

div.head: num
div.p: records the note number.

div.head: num
div.p: records the port value.

div.head: num
div.p: records the program number.

div.head: num
div.p: holds the MIDI sequence number.

div.head: num
div.p: records the velocity value.

div.head: num
div.p: indicates the number of measures of rest.

div.head: num
div.p: indicates the number of measures to be repeated.

div.head: num
div.p: captures the amount of horizontal space to be added, expressed in one-half inter-line staff distance units.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num
div.p: used to store a number to be rendered along with the note. See Read, p. 394, ex. 23-21, line 5.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second. These attributes may be used for explicit labelling of the tuplet, such as, '3' with an 8th-note triplet, '3:2' over a quarter-note triplet, etc. The rendering of the ratio, however, is dependent on the num.format attribute found in the att.vis.tuplet attribute class.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num
div.p: along with numbase, describes duration as a ratio. Num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: num.format
div.p: controls how the num:numbase ratio is to be displayed. When set to 'count' only the num attribute is displayed, e.g., '7'; however, when set to 'ratio', both the num and numbase attributes are displayed, e.g., '7:4'.

div.head: num.place
div.p: records where the number accompanying the tremolo note or chord should be rendered.

div.head: num.place
div.p: states where the tuplet number will be placed in relation to the noteheads.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: numbase
div.p: Together, num and numbase specify the change as a ratio, e.g., 1:3. Numbase is for the second value in the ratio.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: numbase
div.p: along with num, describes duration as a ratio. Num is the first value in the ratio, while numbase is the second.

div.head: oct
div.p: together with the pname attribute, identifies the location where the custos appears.

div.head: oct
div.p: captures written octave information.

div.head: oct
div.p: captures written octave information.

div.head: oct
div.p: captures written octave information.

div.head: oct.ges
div.p: records performed octave information that differs from the written value.

div.head: old
div.p: identifies the old hand. The value must contain the ID of a hand element given elsewhere in the document.

div.head: optimize
div.p: display only those staves with notes?

div.head: orient
div.p: describes the rotation or reflection of the base symbol.

div.head: origin
div.p: designates the origin of the timeline, i.e. the time at which it begins.

div.head: pclass
div.p: holds pitch class information.

div.head: place
div.p: captures the placement of the accidental relative to the staff.

div.head: place
div.p: captures the placement of the item with respect to the staff with which it is associated.

div.head: place
div.p: indicates direction of displacement and display location and therefore is REQUIRED.

div.head: plist
div.p: contains a white-space separated list of ID references to the participants in a collection of elements.

div.head: plist
div.p: contains a list of ids of child <section>, <ending> or <app> elements.

div.head: plist
div.p: may contain white-space separated list of ID references that identify logical events that participate in the control event, such as notes under a phrase mark.

div.head: pname
div.p: in conjuction with the oct attribute, identifies the location where the custos appears.

div.head: pname
div.p: contains the written pitch name.

div.head: pname
div.p: records the written pitch name.

div.head: pname
div.p: contains the written pitch name.

div.head: pname
div.p: contains the written pitch name.

div.head: pname.ges
div.p: records pitch name information that differs from the written value.

div.head: pnum
div.p: holds a pitch-to-number mapping, a base-40 or MIDI note number, for example.

div.head: pos
div.p: records the fret position at which the chord tablature is to be played.

div.head: prev
div.p: points to the previous event(s) in a user-defined collection.

div.head: prolatio
div.p: describes the semibreve-minim relationship.

div.head: prolatio
div.p: describes the semibreve-minim relationship.

div.head: prolatio
div.p: describes the semibreve-minim relationship.

div.head: psolfa
div.p: contains solfa designation, e.g., do, re, mi, etc., in either fixed or movable Do systems.

div.head: reason
div.p: indicates why the text has to be supplied.

div.head: reason
div.p: indicates why the material is difficult to transcribe.

div.head: reason
div.p: gives a reason for the omission.

div.head: ref
div.p: contains a reference to a previously-declared user-defined symbol.

div.head: refrain
div.p: used to indicate a common, usually centered, refrain (Mup User's Guide, p. 44).

div.head: reg
div.p: used to record a regularized form of the name.

div.head: reg
div.p: gives the value of a date in standard ISO form.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the barline.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the curve.

div.head: rend
div.p: indicates whether hash marks should be rendered between systems. See Read, p. 436, ex. 26-3.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the phrase mark.

div.head: rend
div.p: captures whether a beam is feathered and in which direction: 'acc' indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together, coming together at the end of the beam, while 'rit' means that the secondary beams start at the same point and get progressively more distant.

div.head: rend
div.p: captures the appearance of the continuation line associated with the octave displacement.

div.head: rend
div.p: indicates the number of slashes required to render the appropriate beat repeat symbol when the beat is divided into even notes: 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5. When the beat is comprised of mixed duration values, the symbol is always rendered as 2 slashes and 2 dots. See Read, pg. 223-224.

div.head: rend
div.p: captures the appearance of the glissando mark.

div.head: rend
div.p: typographical appearance of the syllable text.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the curve or line.

div.head: rend
div.p: captures whether a beam is feathered and in which direction: 'acc' indicates that the secondary beams get progressively closer together, coming together at the end of the beam, while 'rit' means that the secondary beams start at the same point and get progressively more distant.

div.head: rend
div.p: captures the appearance of the text. One or the other of the rend and altrend attributes is required.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the slur.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the appearance of the tie.

div.head: rend
div.p: contains an indication of how the deletion should be rendered.

div.head: rend
div.p: records the visual appearance of a graphical line.

div.head: rendgrid
div.p: when set to 'grid', the chord tablature grid defined in the chordtable should be rendered instead of the text contents of the <harm> element; if rendgrid equals 'gridname', both the <harm> element's text and the grid should be displayed; otherwise, only the 'name' of the chord, i.e., the text content of the <harm> element, e.g. 'Cmaj' or 'V7/III', should be rendered.

div.head: resp
div.p: records the editor(s) responsible for identifying or creating the annotation. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

div.head: resp
div.p: The editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness may be recorded in the resp attribute. The value of resp must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

div.head: resp
div.p: records the editor(s) responsible for asserting a particular reading in a witness. Its value must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

div.head: resp
div.p: indicates responsibility for the identification of the scribal hand. It must point to one or more of the identifiers declared in the document header, associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

div.head: restart
div.p: indicates that staves begin again with this section.

div.head: rhythm
div.p: used to specify a rhythm for the lyrics that differs from that of the notes on the staff.

div.head: right
div.p: indicates the function of the right barline and is structurally important.

div.head: rotation
div.p: A positive value for rotation rotates the text in a counter-clockwise fashion, while negative values produce clockwise rotation.

div.head: rowspan
div.p: the number of rows spanned by this cell.

div.head: rowspan
div.p: the number of rows spanned by this cell.

div.head: sameas
div.p: points to an element that is the same as the current element but is not a literal copy of the current element.

div.head: scale
div.p: indicates how the symbol should be scaled when rendered.

div.head: scale
div.p: indicates how the staff should be scaled when rendered.

div.head: seq
div.p: provides an integer indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence of the variant readings.

div.head: seq
div.p: used to assign a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

div.head: shape
div.p: decribes the clef symbol.

div.head: shape
div.p: indicates the shape of the clef symbol.

div.head: sign
div.p: the base symbol in the mensuration sign/time signature of mensural notation.

div.head: since
div.p: identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point. The value should be the ID of another when element in the same timeline. If the since attribute is omitted, and the absolute attribute is not specified, then then reference point is understood to be the preceding when element.

div.head: size
div.p: describes the relative size of the mensuration sign.

div.head: size
div.p: describes the relative size of the measure rest symbol.

div.head: size
div.p: describes the relative size of the rest.

div.head: size
div.p: encodes the relative size of the neume.

div.head: size
div.p: describes the relative size of the note.

div.head: size
div.p: describes the relative size of the chord.

div.head: slash
div.p: indicates the number lines added to the mensuration sign. For example, one slash is added for what we now call 'alla breve'.

div.head: slash
div.p: indicates the number of slashes to be drawn. The number of slashes indicates the exact note values in an aural rendition of measured tremolandi, i.e., 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5, 256ths=6. See Read, p. 393-394. The stem modifier (slash or z) must also be explicity set on the child <note> or <chord> element for a complete visual representation.

div.head: slash
div.p: indicates the number of slashes required 4ths or 8ths=1, 16ths=2, 32nds=3, 64ths=4, 128ths=5, 256ths=6.

div.head: slope
div.p: records the slope of the beam.

div.head: slope
div.p: records the slope of the beam.

div.head: slur
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a slur.

div.head: slur
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a slur.

div.head: slur.dir
div.p: indicates the direction of a slur.

div.head: slur.dir
div.p: indicates the direction of a slur.

div.head: slur.rend
div.p: describes the rendering style for slurs.

div.head: slur.rend
div.p: describes the rendering style for slurs.

div.head: source
div.p: contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which attest to a given reading. Each value should correspond to the ID of a <source> element located in the document header.

div.head: spaces
div.p: states how many spaces are covered by the rest.

div.head: spacing
div.p: records the absolute distance (as opposed to the relative distances recorded in <scoredef> elements) between this staff and the preceding one in the same system. This value is meaningless for the first staff in a system since the spacing.system attribute indicates the spacing between systems.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff to which an annotation applies.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff to which the MIDI event applies.

div.head: staff
div.p: describes the staff to which the <midi> element's children apply.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff within which the event is active.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff within which a control event is active.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff to which the lyrics apply.

div.head: staff
div.p: signifies the staff to which the rehearsal mark applies.

div.head: staffloc
div.p: gives the location on the staff.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the first element in the sequence.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the element to which the symbol is attached.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the element to which the tempo mark is attached.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the element to which the turn is attached.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the first element in a sequence of events to which the rehearsal mark applies.

div.head: startid
div.p: holds a reference to the first feature occurring on this surface.

div.head: status
div.p: indicates the degree of correction applied to the text.

div.head: stem.dir
div.p: describes the direction of a stem.

div.head: stem.dir
div.p: describes the direction of a stem.

div.head: stem.len
div.p: encodes the stem length.

div.head: stem.len
div.p: encodes the stem length.

div.head: stem.mod
div.p: encodes any stem "modifiers"; that is, symbols rendered on the stem, such as tremolo or Sprechstimme indicators.

div.head: stem.mod
div.p: encodes any stem "modifiers"; that is, symbols rendered on the stem, such as tremolo or Sprechstimme indicators.

div.head: stem.pos
div.p: records the position of the stem in relation to the notehead(s).

div.head: stem.pos
div.p: records the position of the stem in relation to the notehead(s).

div.head: stem.with
div.p: contains an indication of which staff a note or chord that logically belongs to the current staff should be visually placed on.

div.head: stem.with
div.p: contains an indication of which staff a note or chord that logically belongs to the current staff should be visually placed on.

div.head: stem.x
div.p: records the x coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

div.head: stem.x
div.p: records the x coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

div.head: stem.y
div.p: records the y coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

div.head: stem.y
div.p: records the y coordinate of the stem's attachment point.

div.head: style
div.p: When style is set to 'line', the pedal mark is rendered with a continuous line. When it's set to pedstar, a pedal down is rendered with "Ped.", a pedal up is rendered as "*", and a pedal "bounce" is rendered with "Ped. *". When set to altpedstar pedal up and down indications are the same as with pedstar but a bounce is rendered with "Ped." only.

div.head: subtype
div.p: provide any sub-classification for the element, additional to that given by its type attribute.

div.head: syl
div.p: holds an associated sung text syllable.

div.head: syl
div.p: holds an associated sung text syllable.

div.head: syl
div.p: holds an associated sung text syllable.

div.head: symbol
div.p: specifies the symbol used to group a set of staves.

div.head: symbol
div.p: indicates the left-hand connecting symbol for the staff group.

div.head: synch
div.p: points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

div.head: tab.fret
div.p: records the fret at which a string should be stopped.

div.head: tab.string
div.p: records which string is to be played.

div.head: taktplace
div.p: If takt barlines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened barline. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the barline through the top line of a 5-line staff.

div.head: taktplace
div.p: If takt barlines are to be used, then the taktplace attribute may be used to denote the staff location of the shortened barline. The location may include staff lines, spaces, and the spaces directly above and below the staff. The value ranges between 0 (just below the staff) to 2 * number of staff lines (directly above the staff). For example, on a 5-line staff the lines would be numbered 1,3,5,7, and 9 while the spaces would be numbered 0,2,4,6,8,10. For example, a value of '9' puts the barline through the top line of a 5-line staff.

div.head: target
div.p: encodes the target note when its pitch differs from the pitch at which the custos appears.

div.head: tempo
div.p: records tempo in beats (meter signature denominator) per minute.

div.head: tempus
div.p: describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

div.head: tempus
div.p: describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

div.head: tempus
div.p: describes the breve-semibreve relationship.

div.head: text
div.p: records any text, such as 'gliss', that accompanies the glissando mark.

div.head: text.fam
div.p: provides a default value for the font family name of text (other than lyrics) when this information is not provided on the individual elements.

div.head: text.fam
div.p: provides a default value for the font family name for text (other than lyrics) associated with this staff.

div.head: text.fam
div.p: sets the default font family value for text other than lyrics.

div.head: tie
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tie. If visual information about the tie needs to be recorded, then a <tie> element should be employed.

div.head: tie
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tie. If visual information about the tie needs to be recorded, then a <tie> element should be employed.

div.head: tie.dir
div.p: determines the direction of a tie.

div.head: tie.dir
div.p: determines the direction of a tie.

div.head: tie.rend
div.p: provides a default value for the appearance of ties associated with this staff.

div.head: tie.rend
div.p: describes the default rendering style for ties.

div.head: tie.rend
div.p: describes the rendering style of a tie.

div.head: tie.rend
div.p: describes the rendering style of a tie.

div.head: to
div.p: records a timestamp adjustment of the entity's programmatically-determined location.

div.head: to
div.p: indicates the ending note of the barre.

div.head: to
div.p: contains the end point of a date range.

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time of the barline in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time of the MIDI event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time of the event in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time of a musical feature in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp
div.p: encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part]

div.head: tstamp.ges
div.p: records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

div.head: tstamp.ges
div.p: records the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the measure.

div.head: tstamp.ges
div.p: used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.

div.head: tstamp.real
div.p: records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

div.head: tstamp.real
div.p: records the onset time as a real-time offset, i.e., in HH:MM:SS.ss format, since the beginning of the file.

div.head: tstamp.real
div.p: used to record the onset time in pulses per quarter note (ppq, MusicXML divisions, or MIDI clicks) since the start of the file.

div.head: tune.Hz
div.p: holds a value for cycles per second, i.e., Hertz, for a tuning reference pitch.

div.head: tuplet
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

div.head: tuplet
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

div.head: tuplet
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

div.head: tuplet
div.p: indicates that this element participates in a tuplet.

div.head: type
div.p: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

div.head: type
div.p: specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, that is, whether it is a corpus or an individual text.

div.head: ulx
div.p: indicates the upper-left corner x coordinate.

div.head: uly
div.p: indicates the upper-left corner y coordinate.

div.head: unit
div.p: specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeline.

div.head: unit
div.p: specifies the unit of time in which the timeline is expressed.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the units of measurement of the numeric value.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the unit of measurement for height and width values.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the units of measurement of the extent of the gap.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the unit of measurement of the extent.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the currency of the price.

div.head: unit
div.p: indicates the unit of measurement of the dimensions.

div.head: val
div.p: records the MIDI controller's value.

div.head: valign
div.p: specifies the vertical alignment of the element content.

div.head: value
div.p: records a written accidental.

div.head: value
div.p: records the name of the articulation symbol drawn from the list given in data.ARTICULATIONS.

div.head: value
div.p: a written accidental

div.head: value
div.p: captures a numeric value associated with the graphical dynamic sign.

div.head: value
div.p: used to describe the tempo in beats-per-minute.

div.head: version
div.p: names the version of the schema used by the instance.

div.head: visible
div.p: provides a default indication of whether a layer should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A layer with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a staff should be displayed when the score is rendered. A staff with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a staff group should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A staff group with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a layer should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A layer with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a staff should be displayed when the score is rendered. A staff with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a neume should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A neume with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: visible
div.p: indicates if a note should be displayed when the notation is rendered. A note with this attribute set to 'false' should also not be included in a sounded rendition.

div.head: vo
when
div.p: indicates the point of occurrence along a timeline. Its value must be the ID of a <when> element.

div.head: width
div.p: For rendering purposes, some music data systems rely on measure width data. The width attribute allows for the capture of this data in MEI for output back to these systems.

div.head: width
div.p: specifies the distance, in one-half interline units, between the points of the open end of the mark.

div.head: width
div.p: measurement of the horizontal dimension of the image.

div.head: width
div.p: For rendering purposes, some music data systems rely on measure width data. The width attribute allows for the capture of this data in MEI for output back to these systems.

div.head: with
div.p: In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: with
div.p: In the case of cross-staff tuplets, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: with
div.p: In the case of cross-staff beams, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: with
div.p: In the case of cross-staff tuplets, the with attribute is used to indicate which staff the beam is connected to; that is, the staff above or the staff below.

div.head: wordpos
div.p: records the position of the syllable within a word.

div.head: x
div.p: encodes the optional x coordinate.

div.head: x2
div.p: encodes the optional 2nd x coordinate.

div.head: xlink:actuate
div.p: defines whether a link occurs automatically or must be requested by the user. It is used in conjunction with the show attribute to determine link behavior.

div.head: xlink:href
div.p: allows the use of an previously-undeclared URI to identify an external electronic object.

div.head: xlink:role
div.p: indicates a property of the entire link. The value of the role attribute must be a URI reference as defined in [IETF RFC 2396], except that if the URI scheme used is allowed to have absolute and relative forms, the URI portion must be absolute. The URI reference identifies some resource that describes the intended property. When no value is supplied, no particular role value is to be inferred.

div.head: xlink:show
div.p: defines whether a remote resource that is the target of a link appears at the point of the link, replaces the existing link, or appears in a new window.

div.head: xml:id
div.p: regularizes the naming of an element and thus facilitates building links between it and other resources. Each id attribute within a document must have a unique value.

div.head: xml:lang
div.p: identifies the language of the word or text phrase marked. Its value must be the identifier of a <language> element supplied in the MEI header of the current document.

div.head: y
div.p: encodes the optional y coordinate.

div.head: y2
div.p: encodes the optional 2nd y coordinate.
